H0.text: Fungi have cell walls strengthened by chitin, unlike plant cell walls which contain cellulose.

H1.text: Virus cell walls are strengthened by chitin, unlike plant cell walls, which contain cellulose.

H2.text: Bacterium have cell walls that are strengthened by chitin, unlike plant cell walls, which contain cellulose.

H3.text: Yeast have cell walls strengthened by chitin, unlike plant cell walls which contain cellulose.

A4.text: fungal_Component walls do not contain cellulose

A5.text: fungi are the only organisms that combine these two structural molecules in their cell wall
